adverb.description: In or to what place or position.

relative adverb.description: At, in, or to which (used after reference to a place or situation)
examples: I first saw him in Paris, where I lived in the early sixties

relative adverb.description: The place or situation in which.

examples: do you see where the men in your life are emotionally unavailable to you?
I see where the hotel has changed hands again
where some caregivers burn out, others become too involved

origin: Old English hwǣr, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch waar and German wo.
